title: Email che non arrivano
creator: 8francescodisiena
content: Ho scaricato thunderbird e ci sono passato totalmente. Dopo un giorno, in cui ho aggiunto tanti account outlook, che poi sono stati bloccati e quindi thunderbird continuava ad aprire una finestra con microsoft che mi chiedeva di risolvere l'account. Una volta fatto, inserisco una mail che ho già su thunderbird, per ricevere il codice da scrivere nella pagina di microsoft, ma non arriva niente. Nel vecchio programma che usavo le mail con i codici sono arrivate tutte, perchè poi l'ho fatto con più account e nessun email è arrivata. Intanto però su Thundebird mi stavano arrivando email su altri account, ma queste email sul mio account principale, non sono arrivate

title: Compattazione
creator: matteo.porta
content: Buongiorno Spett.le Thunderbird, mi avvalgo di Thunderbird da molto tempo e non ho mai avuto problemi con la compattazione, eseguita regolarmente e con buon esito. Da pochi giorni, quando viene eseguita la procedura di cui sopra, mi compare una scritta che riferisce che "La cartella "Omissis" non può essere compattata in quanto non è possibile scriverci. Verificare di avere spazio su disco sufficiente e avere privilegi in scrittura, quindi riprovare." Sul pc vi sono ancora a disposizione quasi 300 GB disponibili (in merito ai privilegi in scrittura non ne conosco il significato) e anche il tentativo di compattare separatamente le cartelle non ha buon esito, comparendo sempre la suddetta dicitura (peraltro compare in riferimento alle cartelle più pesanti, aventi qualche GB di dimensione). Vi chiedo cortesemente come possa risolvere la problematica, se possibile. RingraziandoVi sin d'ora per la cortese disponibilità, porgo cordiali saluti. Matteo G. Porta
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/128.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/128.0.0.0;product:thunderbird

title: Falha no processo de exportar perfil na ferramenta de exportar do Thunderbird
creator: andre.ads88
content:
Bom dia a todos!

Vou relatar aqui um problema bem chato que estou passando.

Tive que usar a ferramenta de exportar do Mozilla Thunderbird para salvar o conteúdo de uma conta de e-mail que seria excluída após o processo de "backup" que a ferramenta faz com o processo de exportar.

Fiz como está na documentação do site, porém quando vamos importar a pasta zipada para recuperar o conteúdo da conta excluída, para minha surpresa, o conteúdo da pasta "Enviados" não foi salva.

Aí começou a dor de cabeça, a usuária era uma das diretoras de onde trabalho, por causa dessa "falha" está havendo um descrédito do meu serviço e da minha competência sendo que não fiz nada, apenas usei a ferramenta como sempre uso.

Porém, por algum motivo que desconheço, a ferramenta apenas não salvou os e-mails da pasta "enviados" o restou salvou normalmente.

Há algum bug nesta versão do Thunderbird? Poderiam me ajudar a verificar o que pode ter havido, pois estou sofrendo duras pressões por causa dessa "falha" nesse processo.

Versão do Thunderbird utilizada no processo: 128.1.0esr (64 bits) Sistema Operacional utilizado: Windows 11 64 bits.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Lege e-mails
creator: cas.laansma
content:
Geacht team,

Ik merkte vandaag dat sommige van mijn e-mail berichten, die ik gisteren ontvangen had, opeens helemaal leeg waren. De mail met header was er nog wel, maar zonder inhoud! Gewoon een leeg veld... Het waren gelukkig geen belangrijke berichten, maar ik vind het wel een beetje verontrustend. Hebben jullie hier een verklaring voor en is er iets aan te doen? Of is het gewoon even een onbelangrijke storing? Ik heb de afgelopen dagen ook heel veel overtollige oude e-mails gedelete. Zou het kunnen dat dat er iets mee te maken heeft? (De 'lege' e-mails behoorden trouwens niet tot die gedelete e-mails.)

M.v.g. Cas Laansma

title: Share profile Windows and Ubuntu
creator: marcin.szkudlarz
content:
Hi

I use Thunderbird on Windows (now 11) for 16 years now. Currently I have Thunderbird version 128.1.1. I would like to share profile between Windows and Linux (Ubuntu 24.04) installations on same machine. Profile folder is in a ntfs partition accessible both from Ubuntu (automatically mounted) and Windows. I managed to edit profile.ini file to point to right profile folder. On Windows evenrything workes fine. When I try to open Thunderbird in Ubuntu I get empty folder list and no account information in configuration. In the profile folder there ale many files created with names ending with corrupted are created (like folderTree.json.XXX.corrupt). Another try to open Thunderbird ends with message that profile is already in use. Any advice? Maybe I should debug starting Thunderbird (if yes let me know how to do that).

Thanks in advance. Marcin

title: Thunderbird Supernova->Nebula: Thank you developers and two questions
creator: waltersrobt
content:
I recently switched back to Thunderbird after using Outlook for about 8 years. I was impressed enough with the new UI and enhanced capabilities to make a donation to Thunderbird and I hope to continue doing so annually as a way of encouraging development of this venerable email client.

I have two comments/questions though. First, what is (or was) the rationale for placing the Search Messages tool within the Edit menu? I think it's been located here since time immemorial and while long-time Thunderbird users know this, it still strikes me as misplaced and non intuitive. If one wants to search messages or create message filters, seems to me a better place would be under the Message menu, at least that's where a novice would intuitively go to search for it IMO. Does anyone else feel this way?

Second, in Thunderbird Supernova v. 115.14.0 (just updated to Nebula v. 128.1.1) I have been frustrated by not being able to find the location of new unread email threads when message threads are collapsed. The message thread toggle is on, but it doesn't change color or provide any visual indicator when a new message appears in that thread. This makes it hard to figure out the location of new messages when there are many threaded messages. Am I overlooking something in the UI or is this not a current feature?

Thanks in advance.
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird

title: Unified folders disappear from favorite folders after restarting. Is this a bug?
creator: michelklaasen0
content:
Hiya,

I just started setting up Thunderbird and I have come across a bug. At least, I think it's a bug.

The situation: I'm viewing favorite folders and unified folders. What I want, is to show some unified folders in my favorite folders. That is, my unified inbox, drafts, and sents. So, I right click on them, I select "✅ Favorite folder" and they appear among my favorite folders. All good, right? However... When I restart Thunderbird, the unified inboxes have disappeared from my favorite folders. And when I right click them, it still says they are marked as "✅ Favorite folder" And the way to make them reappear is by deselecting and reselecting them as favorite folders. See the picture.

So, what is happening? Is this a bug? My guess is that it is. Could anyone help me to circumvent this?
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:6141090

title: Please Help, the content of my emails is not visible anymore
creator: info11802
content: Hello, the following has happened: I have a POP3 account with IONOS, which I operate with Thunderbird. Last week I installed a new virus scanner from Bitdefender. After a complete scan, Thunderbird still has all the mails in my inbox that arrived before the scan, but only the headers are still visible. The contents of the mails are no longer visible. Thunderbird has no authorization to Bitdefender “Allow antivirus software to quarantine incoming messages” The inbox has been recreated after the virus scan. Bitdefender has not issued a message about mails or inbox after the scan. Is there an archive for old inboxes somewhere? best reguards, Martin

creator: XTC.fan
content: My old computer died and I'm setting up the new one, including my Thunderbird email. I'm in a catch-22. When I enter my email address as part of reactivating the account, I'm told a code will be sent to that address. But how am I supposed to retrieve the code if I can't get into the account to get the email? I don't get it ......
